channel.title: Comments on: Have you Tried Out Microsoft TFS 2010?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: we're using it here. s'not bad.

item.title: By: Tahir Khalid
item.dc:creator: Tahir Khalid
item.content:encoded:
TFS 2010 has come a long way now and is looking a polished product.

We are using it quite heavily here now for our Agile based Web Development but also for other projects (like the one I am on where we need it just for the PM side).

If you have used the open source/php variants in the past you will recognise the portal features and reporting but it’s nice to have it all in one organised place.

But I have found that you need to really embrace the whole Visual Studio way of doing things otherwise it is hit and miss (and that’s where you would probably be better off with SVN or GIT).

Still great to see MS take a step in the right direction – best way of combating piracy is to offer your products to your potential future customers and users.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: No, haven't tried it even though we have ultimate subscriptions at work. Most of us work on our own stuff and it is not related. Some stuff that is multi person is not in .NET. We are using SVN now and are in the process of evaluating GIT soon
item.content:encoded: No, haven’t tried it even though we have ultimate subscriptions at work. Most of us work on our own stuff and it is not related. Some stuff that is multi person is not in .NET. We are using SVN now and are in the process of evaluating GIT soon
